channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: This is ultimately what I want to do, which is to bring in Pinboard links tagged a certain way to my Jekyll site. That said, I would still like, more generally, a way to pull in content via RSS to a static website. https://t.co/hYf76smKRW

I wondered about this bar given the current situation. I’m glad I got to have drinks there once, but I was uncomfortable about the decor, to say the least. https://t.co/zx5JDZLSHx
The first time I went, it was with a Russian-Canadian colleague. The second time I went, it was with an Eastern European-Canadian colleague who lived under Communism. I forget why we didn’t stay, but I do recall him talking to somebody to see if we could get past the velvet rope.
You know who else couldn’t be happier? COVID-19. https://t.co/q5Wdtodwqv
@artcaninstitute I saw Esmaa Mohamoud’s work at @TheAGH last year. The exhibition is over, but they posted a virtual tour: https://t.co/lCNXcsstso
@GuerricHache Good stuff! I (finally) just bought Books 5 and 6. I’ll start reading Book 3 soon.
Do you see groups of people in indoor spaces not wearing masks and think “These people will either be in the hospital or dead in the next two weeks”? I still do.

I’ll give my MP credit: He’s been doing what I would suggest he do, which is to choose between resigning and acting like he belongs there. He’s chosen to act like he belongs there (I have the calendar for which he for posed several photos to prove it)… https://t.co/EZKqcdjs1U
…but now there’s this. https://t.co/LfMmyjxMWQ
I’ve lost track of which wave we’re in, but no matter which one it is, I’m still not telling my crushes I’m in love with them. https://t.co/Pb6nkSrIFR
Pandemic milestone: I re-installed the Eventbrite app on my iPhone.
@Kimli Nope. It’s the one with future Order of Canada recipient Sandra Oh.

I knew exactly which movie was ranked #1. https://t.co/KCvpB6s8bl
I took @HertzBarry’s 20 best Toronto movies ever made and made it a list on Letterboxd. https://t.co/mR4R8cilup

If it’s truly March 21st that the mask mandate is lifted in Toronto, that would be fortuitous for the upcoming Thorrablót, the traditional Icelandic winter feast organized by @ICCTtweets, which happens on March 26th. https://t.co/9LRJZlpzgL
Don’t worry, we plan on having our own policies at the event.
“No, really, is this a joke?” https://t.co/Lch8hoV6q3
These ads…they’re really…they’re really fucking good. https://t.co/0ujrtGEZPD https://t.co/QDGc7EyIyt
@justagwailo And Sarah Chan!
@Kimli You might be off the hook. That particular soft drink brand (to which I owe my allegiance) just announced that they’re no longer doing business in that particular country.
@Sean_YYZ LP be like LOLP

Some other Richard created a GoFundMe for people who, on March 8th of every year, ask when International Men’s Day is, so they can pay the laziness tax. I’m putting him on my list of Good Richards. https://t.co/Ivdbi9j8Ho

What are the betting odds for the announced (and yet-to-be-announced) leadership candidates for the Conservative Party of Canada? #CPCLeader #CPCLeadership #cdnpoli
Who has the best analysis for what needs to be done to win the leadership of the Conservative Party of Canada? What are the rules, and who’s best situated to win based on those rules? #CPCLeader #CPCLeadership #cdnpoli
Does Jean Charest not have a Twitter account? #CPCLeader #CPCLeadership #cdnpoli
He does, he’s just not verified.
I love posters for software conferences where the subjects look like music festival lineups. https://t.co/sVK8rCyqi9
Say what you will about a dictator who rules over Canada with an iron fist, but it was good of her to meet with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau today. https://t.co/iRjdpNXFy4
https://t.co/ZNVmqrHXyF
The conspiracy theorists must be loving this. https://t.co/tYDHsR4h0l
I have this set now for the WSJ, and I’m wondering if I should keep my subscription to the NYT. https://t.co/htbHSu0gav
@justagwailo And Sarah Chan!
